column1: short and wide outside off, left alone
back of a length in the corridor, defended watchfully from the crease
good length, down leg side. Doesn't go after it
good length, very wide outside off stump. Some swing away. Left alone
full and shaping in at leg stump, flicked neatly to square leg
inswinger traps him on the pad but it's in front leg stump. He didn't see this coming in and it cramped him as he plonked his front leg across to the length ball
nearly breaches the defence on the inside edge. Good length ball, slight shape in from the corridor. Elgar pushes forward tentatively with a gap between bat and pad. Gets an inside edge
back of a length and across off stump, left alone
125kph, back of a length at off stump, defended into the leg side off the back foot
134kph, back of a length at middle stump, defended off the outside half
Elgar reacts very late to this. Seems like he struggled to pick it out the hand. A inswinging yorker headed for off stump, 137kph, bunted back awkwardly, one-handed
138kph, back of a length and shaping in at leg stump, dabbed through square leg
122kph, full and angled away from outside off, left alone
good length, shaped across off stump, left alone
climbs from a length, just outside off. Gets him to chase it with his hands and beats him on the outside edge
127kph, full at off stump, blocked on the front foot
good length, wide outside off, left alone
back of a length outside off, left alone
135kph, back of a length and swinging away outside off, left alone
140kph and full at off stump. Front leg planted across off stump, defended back down the pitch
back of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
full and wide outside off, wobbling a touch. Left alone
back of a length at off stump, hurriedly defended from the crease
full and aimed for off stump. Very late on the attempted drive. Jams it into the front pad off the inside edge
128kph, good length in the corridor, looks to defend as it nips in a touch. It beats the inside edge, clips the front pad on the knee roll and goes through to the keeper. Appeal turned down
full at off stump, once more he drives with no feet. Back down the pitch, deflected wide of the mid-on fielder off the stumps
full and swinging in late at leg stump, big inside edge to fine leg as he brings the bat down late
inside edge to fine leg as he looks to hammer this wide overpitched ball through the covers. Nowhere near it, reaching out a long way
good length and skidding in at middle stump, tapped to square leg
good length in the corridor, wobbles inwards, takes the inside edge and dribbles down to fine leg as he looks to defend
139.9kph, full at off stump. Tapped back firmly and the bowler sticks out his right hand to stop it
good length in the corridor, defended solidly on the front foot
135kph, back of a length in the corridor, left alone
good length, fired in at off stump. He stretches forward to defend but this misbehaves off the pitch. Inside edge and sneaks pitchside from in between his legs
good length at off stump, wathcfully defended from the crease
gets one right. A touch too full outside off and the front foot press takes him to the ball this time, before he uses his wrists to drive this through extra cover
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
full at middle stump, flicked very late but he gets it to beat Mpofu's dive at mid-on. It's parried, really. He has to chase it
good length at off stump, defended off the back foot
127kph, good length at off stump, slight angle back in. Defended late, close to the body, and down the pitch
squeezed into the leg side after an attempted punch through the off side. Another mistimed one from Elgar. This time he even gets rewarded for it - midwicket fumbles and gives away the run
good length at off stump, defended into the leg side
well played. Elgar's slowly getting into his element. Length ball at off stump, a confident stride forward to meet it with a full face. Taps it past the non-striker with a high elbow
back of a length at middle stump, tucked off the thigh guard through backward square
shot. 139kph, overpitched at middle stump. Stands tall and whips this wide of mid-on
back of a length at middle stump, defended off the back foot

beaten on the outside edge as he plays inside the line. This zips through from a length in the corridor. A half-hearted appeal for caught behind is turned down. And a half-hearted review follows. Wicketkeeper Brendan Taylor said he didn't hear anything but Cremer is keen on this. It's a wasted review. There's nothing on that.
back of a length outside off, some lift off the surface. Left alone

sweetly timed again. He's adjusted from lashing out at the ball to allowing it to come on. Stretches forward with a full face again at this length ball, pushes it past the non-striker. Mpofu gives chases and lunges to flick this back
back of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
back of a length at the pads, flicked to deep square leg
good length outside off, defended into the covers
back of a length at middle stump, pushed to midwicket off the back foot
length at off stump, defended off the back foot
full at leg stump, clipped straight to midwicket
132 kph, very short, very wide. Looks to climb on this to try and slap it in front of square. Ends up slicing towards third man, but it's four anyway
chases and misses as this back of a length ball swings away from him. No feet, wafts at it
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
back of a length in the corridor, solidly defended off the back foot
full and swinging away from the corridor, prime for the drive, but he leaves it alone
full and wide outside off, left alone
good length, swinging in at leg stump. Flicked to fine leg
tired bowling. Length, in at the pads. Markram stays tall and allows it to come onto him before clipping it through square leg on the up
good length outside off, left alone
jags away from the pitch after drawing him forward outside off. He was looking to defend this, is beaten
good length, wide outside off. Left alone
good length, slung in at off stump. Elgar strides forward and nudges it wide of mid-off
short and wide outside off, punched straight to point off the back foot
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
full and wide outside off, left alone
back of a length outside off, left alone
good length at leg stump, shovelled to fine leg on the up
good length, outside off. Defended into the covers
short ball at off stump, swivels and pulls aerially. Well, it's aerial at least till where square leg would be. But that fielder is deep now
short one rises at Elgar and he cops it on the glove as he looks to defend off the back foot
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot, right under his eyes
full and in the corridor, pushed to extra cover off the outside half
good length, slanted across off stump. Left alone
overpitched and swinging away outside off, left alone
back of a length, slight shape away from the corridor. Defended off the back foot
outside edge as he looks to dead-bat this length ball outside off. Played slightly inside the line on the front foot. it rolls out to second slip
back of a length at middle stump, poked to mid-on's right off the back foot
too full, enough width. Leans in and drives firmly past mid-off
back of a length in the corridor, murders the bounce with soft hands, gets it into the turf towards the slips
good length, in the corridor. Defended on the front foot
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
yorker at off stump, tapped back to the bowler on the bounce
back of a length in the corridor, pushed to mid-on

shoulders arms to one that's angled in at off stump. It hits him on the back leg. The bowler appeals very late. Keeper follows. They think about the review and won't take it. Good call, that was missing off and probably going above
short ball in the corridor, climbs on top of the bounce and punches through cover point
full at middle stump, defended to mid-on
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
full and very wide. Lets that go
back of a length, in at off stump. Defended down the pitch
back of a length in the corridor, defended off the outside half
good length, wide outside off. Stabs at it, beaten on the outside edge
good length, in at off stump. Defended from the crease
length ball, fourth-stump line, good leave from Markram
back of a length, angling onto Markram's legs, tucked away to long leg
short, angling away from off stump, punched to backward point

beautifully bowled. Fuller this time, on the fuller side of a good length, slanting across to a fifth-stump line. Draws Elgar into a poke away from his body but his feet go nowhere, and the ball beats his edge comfortably
a touch shorter and closer to off stump, defended into the covers
length ball on off stump, defended into the off side. This is a really good length because it's pinning Elgar to the crease
full, a bit of swing away from off stump. Only a tiny bit, and Markram defends into the covers
back of a length, close to off stump. Markram gets right behind it to block it back to the bowler
length ball outside off, a big stride forward and confident upward thrust of his bat to leave the ball
back of a length on off stump, defended back down the pitch
length ball close to off stump, defended towards mid-on
a touch straighter, on middle stump, and Markram tucks it away neatly to deep square leg
as soon as I say that, Muzarabani overpitches one outside off stump. Markram leans forward and puts it away between short cover and mid-off
full again, though not as full as the previous ball, and he checks his drive as a result. Mid-off moves to his left to stop it
back of a length, angling into the body, worked away through the vacant midwicket region
length ball slanting away from off stump, left alone
short, wide, and Elgar gets up on his toes to ride the bounce and slap that away through cover point
fullish, close to off stump, defended towards mid-off
full, perhaps looking for the yorker, ends up bowling it too straight. Clipped off the toes to long leg
fullish outside off, and that's excellent from Elgar. Wasn't a half-volley by any means, but he got a nice stride forward and transferred his weight into an on-the-up drive to the right of mid-off
nicely bowled. Pulls his length back just a touch, and angles it in a little further, into the fifth-stump channel. Elgar leaves confidently

nicely bowled again, some extra bounce from just short of a length in the corridor. Elgar plays it well, close to his body, and removes his bottom hand upon impact to cushion it down towards gully. Hit the splice of his bat

there's that little poke. Excellent sequence of deliveries from Mpofu. Angled in again, a good length. He's pressed forward without really getting a stride in, and the ball straightens off the pitch to beat the outside edge of his defensive bat
a bit fuller, defended towards mid-off
a touch short outside off, takes a step deep into his crease and slaps to backward point
back of a length on off stump, jabbed to backward point
fuller now, angling into off stump, defended to mid-on
short outside off, and that is put away with a bit of arrogance. A step back and across, swivels on his right foot, and rolls his wrist over the pull to beat deep square leg diving to his left
back of a length close to off stump, defended into the covers
back of a length on off stump, and he works this just wide of mid-on to pick up one
back of a length on middle stump, tucked away to long leg
back of a length, close to off stump, defended into the point region
gone! Fullish on off stump, and Elgar is a touch early into his flick, fatally so. Chips it in the air, and straight into midwicket's lap
length ball in the corridor, left alone
back of a length on off stump, nice bounce. Gets back and across and defends with soft hands towards gully
length ball, a tiny bit of inward seam towards middle stump. Amla defends slightly outside the line and the inside edge rolls down to long leg
back of a length, sixth-stump line, left alone
good ball, fullish and angling into middle stump, looking for the lbw while Amla is still new at the crease. Resists the temptation to play across the line and shows the full face to defend to mid-on
shorter now, in the corridor, left alone
shortish again, fifth-stump line. Amla leaves, swinging his gloves and bat out of the way
good ball, angles this in from a little wider on the crease. Amla leaves alone, judging the line well

ooh, early into the drive, much like Elgar. This one is full outside off, inviting the cover drive. Goes at it with his hands without really getting forward, and the bottom hand takes over to send it rolling into the on side
length ball, fourth-stump line, defended to short cover
back of a length on off stump, gets nicely behind the line to defend back down the pitch
fuller now, fifth-stump line, left alone. Excellent stride forward there

ohhh. Muzarabani did this earlier, and now Jarvis hits that perfect length in that fifth-stump channel. Gets forward and across to defend, and plays at it when he could have simply left it alone. Straightens to beat the outside edge
fullish, closer to off stump, defended to mid-off
length ball, fifth-stump line with a tiny bit of outswing, left alone
lovely. Full ball at off stump, stands tall to let it come on and punches it with balance, past the bowler and mid-off

hits it straight to cover. A woeful delivery, only outdone by a soft shot. Mpofu puts the wicket in his imaginary pocket and zips it up with a sheepish smile, because this one is a Christmas gift. Short and wide outside off, he pushes with an open face with no intent to keep it down or find a gap
length at leg stump, cops it on the pad as he looks to flick
good length and in at leg stump, pushed on the up to midwicket
first runs in Tests in nearly two years. Streaky. This dips in late as he brings an angled bat down to try and drive to mid-on. Bat face closes and it goes wide of Blessing, the fielder there
back of a length in the corridor, tapped to cover's left on the up
short ball at the chest, climbs above it and keeps the hook down to fine leg
back of a length in the corridor, bit of extra bounce. Defended off the sticker of the bat
132kph, good length outside off. Leans in for the drive and then retreats at the last moment, loses his balance
good length in the corridor, defended to cover on the front foot
good length on middle and leg, shuffles and shows leg stump as he flicks hurriedly to fine leg
back of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
played. This length ball on leg stump wasn't quite in his arc - was climbing a touch. But he maintains his balance after shuffling and uses soft hands to whip this late, on the rise, past midwicket

a big smile from AB de Villiers. He knows what a sensational straight drive this is. Full ball at off stump, an ever-so-slightly closed face of the bat comes down on it and punches it to bisect the non-striker and the stumps.
good length at off stump, full face of the bat again as he punches this back at the bowler
back of a length and wide outside off, left alone
back of a length at off stump, defended under his eyes
good length at middle stump, tapped to deep square leg with a closed face
back of a length at off stump, defended into the covers off the back foot
dropped short outside off, cut emphatically to sweeper's left
short ball spinning away from off stump, punched to sweeper cover
beaten on the outside edge and nearly falls over to get stumped. This dips outside off at a length and completely beats him. Just manages to stay in the crease.
good length outside off, beats him on the drive again. De Villiers nowhere near the pitch at the moment
good length at off stump, driven on the up to mid-off
short and wide outside off, lines up and chops this hard. Finds backward point
full and hooping away in the corridor. Tapped to cover on the front foot
full outside off, jams it into the turf with an attempted cover drive
good length in the channel, defended into the off side
good length just outside off, left alone
length at middle stump, defended on the front foot
short and turning away, chopped to sweeper cover
overpitched outside off, jammed into the covers off the toe-end
googly, picked. Good length and in at off stump. Dead-bats it to short leg
full at middle stump, defended solidly on the front foot
back of a length outside off, left alone
full toss floated up nicely at middle stump. Driven firmly past de Villiers, but not firm enough to beat mid-on to his left
back of a length at middle stump, dropped into the leg side with soft hands
good length and down leg side, left alone
good length at off stump, pushed to mid-on off the inside half
back of a length in the corridor, swivels and adjusts as this stops on him a touch. Whips to deep square
good length outside off, big stride as he defends
yorker at middle stump, tapped to deep square's right off the toe-end of the bat
back of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
good length and just outside off, no movement. Defended comfortably into the covers
good length in the corridor, defended solidly on the front foot
full at off stump, not to the pitch for this drive. Bat turns in his hands and he gets three runs, wide of mid-on, because it pays to be a batsman
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
back of a length just outside off, inside edge onto pad and dribbles into the square leg region. Couldn't get on top of this with a forward stride
good length and in at off stump, defended solidly from the crease
swings away a touch after starting on middle stump. He wants to punch this towards mid-on but is squared up and gets a leading edge through cover
full and in at off stump, defended solidly on the front foot
good length, shaping away late again in the corridor. Defended down the pitch with hardly any feet
clattered. It's not a quick pitch, and the 127kph speed on this short ball isn't sufficient to bounce de Villiers. Springs above the bounce and pulls through midwicket from outside off
lost his length. Another short one outside off, shuffles and gets close to this before slicing it through cover with an angled bat
good length at off stump, defended to mid-on
nicely bowled. Throws the bait up, full and swinging away outside off. Left alone
back of a length at off stump, waits for it to come on and tickles it into the leg side to steal a single from midwicket and bring up another Test fifty
good length just outside off, inside edge as he defends on the front foot
back of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
one-handed drive back at the bowler. This is full outside off and he's at it quickly with a half stride
good length, wide outside off. Nips away off the surface but this is left alone
back of a length at middle stump, tapped to deep square
good length outside off, pushed on the rise to cover's left
nicely done. Length ball wobbles a bit outside off, draws him in and cuts away just enough to beat the outside edge
full and swinging late outside off, defended solidly on the front foot
good length outside off, defended to extra cover on the front foot
back of a length, cramping him in the corridor. Tapped back to the bowler off his toes
good length and in at off stump, defended off the back foot

picks the slower ball late, but adjusts quickly to whip this over the deep square leg boundary...square leg was in this time. It was short, climbing up at his mid-riff and he got under this to swivel and slap it
full and swinging away from off, left alone
outside edge falls short of second slip. Good length ball outside off, straightens as he leans into it. Soft hands from him, to his credit. He was in control of that
length outside off, squeezed out to point off the outside edge
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
back of a length outside off, defended off the back foot
overpitched outside off, elegantly drive after getting to the pitch but extra cover gets a hand on it
good length at off stump, flicked to deep square
back of a length outside off, defended off the back foot
good length outside off, defends towards mid-on and makes a late call for the single
length ball outside off, gets on top of it quickly on the front foot and paddles it to long leg
dropped short outside off, cut to sweeper cover
short ball spinning away from off stump, punched to sweeper cover
wrong'un, good length and in at leg stump. Defended to short leg
good length at off stump, slides straight on. Blocked on the front foot
back of a length in the corridor, pushed to extra cover off the back foot
leading edge to backward point as he looks to flick this. Chibhaba's getting shape away and this is another from the collection. Full and moving away outside off
full at off stump, shuffles and pushes it wide of mid-on
good length outside off, swinging away again, big shuffle to cover off stump and leaves it
gets this one to nip back in off the pitch, at a similar line and length outside off. Draws him forward and gets him to inside edge onto back thigh
back of a length at middle stump, clipped to deep square leg

struck on the pad, but it appears he's well outside off. The umpire gives it not out, and Cremer reviews it. This one went straight through outside off. De Villiers has been standing on a middle stump line and shuffling across against Chamu. Does it once again to try and defend, and on first look seems to be outside the line...it is, and the third umpire's also found an inside edge on that. Zimbabwe are out of reviews.
loopy one wide outside off, which he doesn't get to the pitch to. Slices it out to sweeper cover
beats the outside edge again. Drifts and drops quickly outside off, draws him in, turns it away
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper cover
and again. He keeps floating outside off, they keep chasing it. Beaten as he looks to defend
this is good from Cremer. Lot of air, dropping in at off stump. Defended off the outside half

awful delivery to finish. Looks like he wanted to push a straighter one in. But he drops it wayyy too short. It's outside off, but there's enough time for him to sit on the back foot and pull this over the wide long-on boundary
back of a length outside off, no feet, all wrists, as he tucks this to deep square
glorious straight drive but he's hit it straight at the stumps. This was overpitched and in at off stump. Punches very firmly and manages to split the stumps, but they've taken enough pace off it
good length at off stump, pokes it through the open midwicket area off the inside half
good length, into the corridor. Defended off the back foot
good length, wide outside off. Left alone
gets the straight drive past the bowler, then past mid-off. Another overpitched ball at off stump, solidly punched
tossed up outside off, hammered into the covers, can't beat extra cover's lunge to the left
floated up outside off, picked on the full and paddled fine of long leg
good length, dipping outside off, left alone
good length outside off, defended on the front foot
the token loose ball. Cremer is struggling to keep an otherwise tantalising line. This is a full toss at off stump and he chips it over mid-on
back of a length outside off, pushed to extra cover off the back foot
full outside off, plants the front foot across into the off side and flicks to deep square
full outside off and driven back at the bowler
nips in from outside off and beats him on the inside edge. Catches him on the back leg as he pushes at it. Must have been outside off again, appeal turned down
outside edge runs away between first slip and gully. Shapes away late, gets him forward, finds the edge. No success
full at middle stump, flicked to deep midwicket's left
full and in the corridor, defended to mid-on
nicely tossed up on middle stump, defended to mid-on
fullish on off stump, uses his wrists to clip that to the right of midwicket
nice length on middle and off, blocked back to the bowler
a touch short on off stump. Goes back to try and whip into the leg side, can't beat short leg
nice length again, on leg stump, clipped to short leg
quickish, back of a length on off stump, punched into the covers
on the pads, clipped to deep square leg
length ball on off stump, clipped to the right of mid-on
short, just outside off stump. AB is slightly early on this pull, hits close to the toe-end of the bat, and he hits it over the top, into the vacant long-on region
back of a length on off stump, uses his wrists to work it to the right of mid-on and move to his 40th Test fifty. It's like he never went away
fullish outside off, strides forward and defends with soft hands towards backward point
full outside off, a hint of outswing, left alone
short and wide, but he has a sweeper on the cover point boundary to minimise the damage of such accidents in length. Just a single for the horizontal-bat slap
tossed up on off stump, defended into the covers
nice length outside off, gets some turn and bounce but Markram leaves it
full on off stump, defended back towards the bowler
floated up enticingly outside off, driven to sweeper cover

short again, pulled to the right of mid-on and the man at deep square leg - Burl, I think - covers a lot of ground to his left and makes a tumbling stop, picking it up and flicking it to mid-on who's chasing from the opposite direction
shortish, close to off stump, jabbed to backward point
short and wide this time, and it's put away very well. Slaps hard, to the right of backward point, and the sweeper is left with too much ground to cover to his left
back of a length close to off stump, defended to short cover
length ball, fourth-stump line, takes a good step forward and clips it gently to mid-on's right for another single - he picks up so many singles in that area against good balls

bang! for the third time South Africa lose a wicket to a soft dismissal. Fullish outside off, not full enough for the drive, and AB drives on the up, checks his shot, and ends up sending a return catch to Mpofu, who reacts well, gets down low, on both knees, and takes it to  his left with both hands about a foot off the ground
good ball to greet the new man, on a good length and angling into off stump. Gets on the front foot and defends nice and close to his body
googly, flighted and pitched full on middle stump. Clipped with the turn into the square leg region
lovely delivery, looped up high and fairly wide of off stump, inviting the drive away from the body. Pushes at it with hard hards, and the thick edge runs away wide of slip
shot. Another good ball, on a nice length just outside off, but Bavuma stretches out this time, gets really low, and laps it fine
beautiful length on leg stump, and Bavuma closes his bat face early, looking to flick without really getting fully forward. Leading edge rolls back to the bowler
quickish length ball on middle and off, again a bit of a leading edge. Wanted to defend that towards mid-on, I think, and it runs away to backward point
ohhh, he's looking uneasy here. Quicker one, flat and skids on and doesn't miss off stump by much. Not short enough to pull, and he doesn't connect at all
length ball on off stump, defended to mid-on
nice length again, fifth-stump line this time, and Markram ignores it
fuller now, on off stump, driven to mid-on
length ball close to off stump, defended to short cover
back of a length outside off, a little hint of away movement. Punches away from his body and it goes to gully, on the bounce, off the outside half of the bat
overpitched outside off, and Markram won't miss out on these. Shows the full face and punches between short cover and mid-off
good length, floated up outside off. Left alone
drifted in at off on a full length, covers off stump and leaves
tossed up outside off, gets down and taps it to long leg
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
tossed up at middle stump, defended into the leg side
back of a length, wide outside off. Left alone
full outside off, left alone
good length, wide outside off and shaping away. Left alone
back of a length outside off, leaves it alone
good length and in at off stump, defended solidly on the front foot
back of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
back of a length at middle stump, flicked to midwicket on the rise
good length outside off, spinning away and bouncing. Left alone
full outside off, tapped to extra cover off the front foot
short and wide outside off, reaches out for it and plays a controlled late cut to beat backward point to his left
good length, floated up outside off. Covers the line and leaves
low full toss down leg side, flicks it to long leg's left
short outside off, cut to sweeper point
back of a length in the corridor, quickly pushed back as he looks to defend. This spat up off the surface
short ball at the chest, pulled to deep square
back of a length, swinging away outside off. Squeezed off the outer half with an open face, beats backward point
hello. Gets another one to climb and this time more viciously than the last one. Beats it into a length in the corridor, and it shoots away from the outside edge rapidly
good length at off stump, defended off the back foot
good length at off stump, defended solidly on the front foot
back of a length at middle stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
back of a length and skidding straight through. Pushes away off the outer half
inside edge evades the stumps. He looks to cut and manages to get far away from it to lose control. It goes fine, to long leg's right
length at middle stump, flicked through square leg
back of a length at leg stump, defended into the midwicket area
back of a length at leg stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
overpitched outside off, driven straight to extra cover
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
short and just outside off. Makes room and cuts straight to point. They take off for a suicidal run. Bavuma leaps into the crease in panic but the throw is very wide
length outside off, spinning away as he leaves
floated up outside off, gets to the pitch and carves it to sweeper cover
good length at off stump, defended with soft hands on the front foot
good length and in at middle stump, goes deep in the crease and pushes to midwicket
short and wide outside off, spins in a long way but he leaves safely
length at middle stump, defended with the turn off the back foot
good length at middle stump, happy to stay on the back foot. Defends
short one at middle stump, shapes to pull, adjusts for the turn and bounce and tickles it deftly off the hip to pick up two through square leg
back of a length at middle stump, flicked to midwicket

there's the hundred. Sweeper cover comes in to save the single so he goes through him instead. It's floated up at off stump, he makes the pitch of and opens the face to find the extra cover boundary and continue a dream start at Test level
short and wide outside off, chopped to sweeper's left
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper
short ball outside off, punched to sweeper off the back foot
good length outside off, defended on the front foot
googly, full at off stump. Yorks himself and just manages to jam it out
full outside off, swept out to long leg
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
good length outside off, defended into the covers
full at off stump, plants the front leg to the pitch of this and drives to long-on
floated up juicily outside off. Waits for it to land in his half and places the cover drive nicely through extra
good length at leg stump, flicked into the square leg region with soft hands
back of a length outside off, tapped to point off the back foot
short and wide outside off, backs away and chops it to sweeper's left
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
good length outside off, some turn away, left alone
back of a length outside off, punched to sweeper cover off the back foot
googly starts too short and too far down leg side. Tucked fine off the thigh guard
full and drifted wide outside off. Stretches far and drives to extra cover
back of a length at middle stump, defended off the back foot
back of a length at leg stump, dabbed to long leg's right
good length at leg stump, flicked to square leg's right off the inside half
full at off stump, defended into the covers
back of a length at leg stump, flicked to long leg
good length outside off, draws him forward and takes it past the outside edge
good length outside off, doesn't get to the pitch and this spins past his blade as he looks to play the paddle sweep
tossed up outside off, withdraws the bat after stretching forward to let this go
full at off stump, looks to drive through extra cover, gets an inside edge towards deep midwicket
lifted over the bowler, easy peasy. Tossed up at off stump, half-stride to get to the pitch and a full flow of the face to send this for four
length outside off, spins and bounces away after drawing him forward
good length, thrown wide outside off. Left alone
dropped short on middle stump, whipped to deep midwicket
back of a length at middle stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
dropped very short, and it's spinning down leg side. He follows it with a horizontal bat and swats it past square leg
good length, slides past the outside edge outside off stump
back of a length outside off, punched to point's right off the back foot
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper's left
back of a length at leg stump, flicked to square leg
good length at off stump, defended to extra cover
back of a length at off stump, defended back to the bowler
good length outside off, hides the bat behind front pad, leaves this
too easy. Short ball outside off, gets on top of it with balance and punches through cover point
good length and just outside off, left alone
full and swinging away outside off, left alone
inside edge and into his back knee. That stung. He did't get to the pitch of this outside off as he looked to drive
back of a length in the corridor, chopped to sweeper off the back foot
good length at off stump, defended to mid-off
full outside off, dead-batted into the off side
good length outside off, defended into the off side
leading edge is well short of point. Looked to flick against the turn, was nowhere near the pitch
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper
good length outside off, leaves
good length outside off, defended on the front foot
good length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
good length, in at middle stump. Tapped to mid-on from the crease

stunning catch by Taylor. One-handed leap to his right to hold on with his fingers. A length ball in the corridor, Markram late on it with the forward push and plays inside the line too. Was pushing outside his body and got a big edge. The wide slip leaped to his left as this was dying on him. But that wasn't an issues because Taylor skipped to his right and stretched a long long way to his right to hold on
full at middle stump, closes the face too early and gets a leading edge that rolls past gully
full at off stump, driven to mid-off
full and swung in at middle stump, pushed back to the bowler
short and wide outside off, he's in disbelief at first that he's got this first up. Languid cut to sweeper's right. Raza gets to the ball after sprinting to his right but falters with the gather
short and into the thigh guard, deflected into the leg side
back of a length in the corridor, very close to the body. Left alone
back of a length, slanted across the corridor. Left alone
length ball pushed wide outside off, left alone
nearly prises him out. Full ball slanted across off stump, he looks to drive but the hands go before the feet. No balance whatsoever. Beaten
short and in at leg stump, tickles it fine with help from the thigh guard
good length and wide outside off, left alone
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
good length and in at leg stump, struck on the thigh guard as he prods at this
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
length on off stump, defended off the back foot
back of a length outside off, guided straight to gully off the outside half
beaten on the outside edge again. Slanted across the corridor, back of a length. Subdued, half-cut from De Kock
back of a length and nipping back in at middle, defended into the leg side
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
good length at leg stump, flicked to long leg
back of a length outside off, left alone
length and in at leg stump. Straightens a touch as he looks to flick. Rolls back down the pitch

finds his outside edge eventually but it dips well in front of first slip and sneaks through. A short-arm jab from De Kock, angled bat. It was very close to his body. The edge pitches well in front of the keeper, for line, and too wide for him too. Meaning first slip had next to no chance
length in the corridor, left alone
length across off stump, left alone
good length, probing in the corridor. Gets it tangled between his legs as he defends on the front foot
overpitched just outside off, driven with the full face to mid-off
full at off stump, driven to mid-off
full in the corridor, squeezed into the point area off the outside edge
short ball, slanted wide. Left alone
back of a length on off stump, tapped into the turf from right under his eyes
length ball dolly, floated up wide. De Kock resists and leaves
good length and away from off stump, left alone
good length on off stump, gets close with the stride and punches on the rise to extra cover
back of a length in the corridor, jammed into the turf as he looks to punch off the back foot
back of a length and climbing in towards the body from a corridor line. Adjusts for the bounce by taking his hand off this, and comes back for the second as the edge teases fine leg
back of a length outside off, angles in and nips away. Beaten

edges through to the keeper and Jarvis' persistence has been rewarded. He's bowling superbly in this spell, wobbling it this way and that in the corridor. This time he draws him forward and gets it to straighten marginally outside off. Bavuma is playing close to the body and the front leg is out there as well. But that ball is too good. Taylor takes easily to his right
length outside off, slight swing away. Left alone
oh yes. You do not want to be facing him right now. Does a Philander to Philander. Gets it wobbling at a length in the corridor, shaping in, then moving away and past the hanging bat
beauty. A touch too full to cause trouble. It's outside off and he drives through the line, and there's no convetional mid-off
good length outside off, tentative half-leave outside off. Gets it fine off the inside edge
full and wide outside off, chopped into the covers
full outside off, shuffles across this time to get closer and drive it wide of mid-off with a lot of control. Cremer gives chase and pulls it back cleanly with a slide
back of a length outside off, chopped into the off side off the under edge
full and just outside off, driven straight to cover
short ball angled across off stump, comes on slower than he expects and he waits before putting the pull shot away coolly to the square leg boundary
back of a length at off stump, punched to extra cover
good length in the corridor, defended on the front foot
back of a length outside off, tapped wide of extra cover on the rise
good length and in at middle stump, defended down the pitch
back of a length at off stump, dropped into the off side off the back foot
overpitched outside off, driven sweetly on the up but straight to mid-off
short and wide outside off, chopped to deep point's left. Mpofu cleans up as De Kock hobbles for the second
back of a length across the corridor, chopped to gully
swats this length ball hard, but hits it straight to deep point
full at middle stump, pushed back down the pitch
back of a length, upright seam, swinging away from the corridor. Left alone
deftly steered. Length ball outside off at 119kph, gives him the time to chase with just his hands and guide it past third slip
good length at middle stump, pushed into the midwicket region
back of a length and spinning into the pads, glanced to long leg
googly at a length, pitches on leg stump and slides down. Gives Masakadza a long chase after deflecting of Taylor's glove
full at off stump, driven straight to extra cover

misses a googly and is struck in front. On the front foot to defend, beaten on the inside edge and Ketleborough gives it out. Philander reviews. He might have a chance on line, this looked like it could have been going down...nope it isn't. Hitting leg stump halfway up. Philander gone, along with a review. It appeared close because he'd put a big stride in and that googly had spun a long way. The umpire too his time and made a good decision
length ball at leg stump, spins past the inside edge by a long way as he gets on the back foot
back of a length outside off, carved to deep point
back of a length outside off, left alone
stylish square drive. Good length, wide outside off. Leans in gracefully and opens the face to beat point
full outside off, elegant drive again. Can't beat extra cover to his left
back of a length wide outside off, left alone
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
floated up outside off, flicked to midwicket
short and down leg side, half-hearted attempt to tickle it fine. Beaten
sweeps and misses to be caught in front of off stump. It's very full. Looks to be smashing leg stump on first look. De Kock won't even review it. Cremer getting em

it appears Rabada has run himself out. It's been sent upstairs. Zimbabwe are convinced. Full ball at off stump, drives inside-out, wide of cover. A decent shot, but a strange decision to come back for a second. The throw is good to the striker's end, on the bounce. Rabada slides and can't make it. Replays confirm he is out. He jogged for the first, indicating a second run was never on his mind. Until, suddenly, it was.
googly slides past the inside edge as he pushes forward. Gets him on the pad and this one is definitely going down leg
back of a length and turning away outside off, poked to extra cover's right. His throw hits the stumps, deflects past square leg and gives them a run after a slight mix up
bouncer at a leg stump line, he ducks under it
slashes aerially and, it appears, over point. Yep, that fielder couldn't get a hand on it with his leap upwards. Short ball outside off and he clobbers this
Burl dives low to his left at gully and holds on. Back of a length ball shapes away in the corridor. Draws the bat out, takes the edge and he's held on very nicely

Morkel has pinned him in front first ball, Paul Reiffel has given it, and a review has been made. This looks very plumb. Very straight. Height always a factor with Morkel, but his front leg has not moved at all. This doesn't look good.Hitting the top of leg stump. Which means the review goes first ball
back of a length, climbing up in the corridor and past the outside edge as he's late on the back foot defence
full and angled across the corridor, draws him forward and beats the outside edge
back of a length, climbs back in nastily from off stump and catches him flush on the box. Might not be a bad idea to declare and bowl right about now...
back of a length at off stump, and a very brave leave as this nips back in and rises above the stumps
full in the corridor, punched firmly back, straight at the bowler
good length, swinging away from outside off. Left alone
full and swinging away outside off, left alone
good length, straight through in the corridor. Tapped to square leg from deep in the crease
length ball, straight at off stump. Defended solidly on the back foot
no clue. The batsman doesn't know what's happened there. Length ball, full in the corridor. He puts the bat down like an afterthought as this zips away
back of a length, swinging away, well outside off and left alone
back of a length, in the corridor, left alone
140kph, good length and wide outside off. Happy to leave
good length in the corridor, draws him forward and straightens it past the outside edge
overpitched outside off, brings the bat down hard on this with good timing. Just jabs at it. Rabada can't stop it to his left at mid-off
back of a length outside off, left alone
good length, in the corridor. Fishes for it, beaten
back of a length at middle stump, whipped to fine leg's left, standing tall on his toes
back of a length, in at off stump, then away from off stump. Yep. Beaten.
back of a length at off stump, dabbed into the off side with soft hands
full at off stump, driven on the up to mid-off
good length at off stump, finds him in the crease with hard hands. Thick outside edge won't get past fourth slip, because Bavuma is there with his dive
good length at off stump, another outside edge. This lands short of third slip. Playing inside the line, a sure sign of nerves
good length at middle stump, nudged towards short leg from deep in the crease
pins him on the back thigh, but he's leaping and that's not hitting the stumps. Zips in from a length outside off
back of a length, climbing in at off stump. Batsman jumping again to get bat on this with a closed face. Gets it straight to short leg
thick outside edge sails to the backward point boundary. No forward movement from the batsman against this length ball on off. Playing inside the line
good length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
back of a length in the corridor, soft hands as he defends from the crease. Gets it wide of backward point
back of a length at middle stump, inside edge onto thigh as he defends on the back foot
moves it too far away from the corridor, beats the outside edge on the back foot
good length and down leg side, left alone
length on leg stump, can't get bat on the attempted flick. Trickles fine off the pad
good length and in at leg stump, rapped on the pads as he looks to flick
good length in the corridor, wobbles in, so he goes for it. Then he watches it climb past the outside edge
good length and in at off stump. It doesn't rise as much as he expects and he's reaching down to get bat on this after jumping. Taps it to mid-on

Bavuma snaps it high to his left with the reverse cup at fourth slip. But there's a doubt here with Morkel's front foot. There seems to be nothing behind the crease...and the third umpire deems in his favour. Morkel goes full at Chibhaba, who still won't put the front foot out as he looks to drive. Well away from the body, big outside edge. Taken with characteristic flair
short ball in at the thigh, struck on the body as he leaps to try and defend
short ball outside off, left alone
full and just outside off. Defends very close to the body on the front foot
short ball in the corridor, rises sharply. He gets the bat out of the way with dropping wrists
good length and angled away from off, left alone
back of a length at off stump, defended onto his toe as he climbs on the back foot
good length at leg stump, pushed into the leg side on the rise
short ball at off stump, watchfully defended off the back foot
good length at off stump, dead-bats it into the turf
141kph, rapped on the thigh pad as this cuts back in from the surface, instead of going on with the angle

'yeahhh beauty,' AB de Villiers screams from behind the wicket after taking a straightforward catch. It's been said for years that Morkel would be a lot more dangerous if he bowled fuller. He's done it again. Full and nipping away naughtily in the corridor. It's an anxious forward poke from Taylor, not fully committed. Means his bat is ahead of his pad a touch and that margin is enough for it to find the outside edge
good length and angled across the corridor. Another hanging bat feels the wind as the ball fizzes past the outside edge. Wasn't far from off stump either

good length at middle stump, gets behind it nicely and pushes through the vacant mid-on region to pick up his first runs in Test cricket. Rabada shies at the non-strikers and gives away an overthrow...and it was justified. That was really close as Ervine stretched out.
back of a length at off stump, left on height
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
back of a length at off stump, defended on the back foot
beats the inside edge and raps him on the thigh guard as he looks to defend against this length ball in the corridor
short ball, wide outside off and moving away. Left alone
good length, wide outside off. Left alone
good length, wide outside off. Left alone
good length at middle stump, defended on the back foot
full and just outside off, defended to mid-off on the front foot
narrowly misses off stump as he shoulders arm. This nips in late from the corridor and he's done everything right with the leave
good length and climbing in at the box - hitting it too - from a middle stump line. He came very close to the stumps with that delivery

full, striking in front of leg, no forwards stride and looks very plumb, as evidenced by Philander's sprint down the track. Umpire gives, Ervine reviews. The decision stands and it's so so close. Ervine is an unlucky man. Half that ball is pitching in line, half hitting in line, and it's umpire's call on the wickets too. Decision stands
good length, wide outside off. Chases, beaten
good length at middle stump, squeezed past square leg off the inside edge
full at off stump, driven off the toe-end, with an open face, to point
fierce bouncer that he does very well to get under. That was headed for the grille
short ball in the corridor, rising away. Drops the wrists and lets it go
attempted yorker goes wrong. It's a full toss on the pads and he duly whips it wide of mid-on to pick up a four
back of a length outside off, left alone
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
good length in the corridor, defended solidly on the front foot
good length, in the corridor. Beaten on the front foot, on the outside edge as he looks to defend
length at off stump, beaten on the outside edge again as he stretches forward
back of a length in the corridor, wafts away from the body, beaten
good length, outside off, swinging away. Beaten
bat! He gets bat. Length ball outside off, straight through in the corridor. Defended into the covers
good length in the corridor, solidly defended on the front foot
overpitched wide outside off, plonks the front leg across and drills this wide of mid-off. He's looked very confident so far
good length outside off, left alone
beaten. Good length, slanted across off stump. Hangs the bat out and can't make connection
back of a length, shaped into the pads. Strikes the front one as he goes on the back foot
short ball at the pads. Stands tall and tickles it fine. Keshav Maharaj snaps out of his deep thoughts at fine leg and sprints to his right to keep this in with a slide
length outside off, defended into the covers
good length and in at leg stump. Looks to flick, cops it on the pad. Half-appeal
good length outside off, defended back to the bowler
full at off stump, solidly blocked on the front foot
good length and in at off stump, defended off the inside half
nearly finds the outside edge. So close. Comes in on the angle but not quite enough as he looks to drive through the covers on the up.
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
back of a length in the corridor, straightens past the outside edge as he covers the off stump to try and defend
good length at middle stump, defended off the back foot
finds the boundary to end the day. Full and into the pads. Holds his shape and flicks with good timing to get this wide of fine leg
full and moving away outside off, past the outside edge
full and straight, clipped to square leg
blocked to the off side
full and outside off, Jarvis leans into it and drives it straight down the ground and beats mid-off
fuller than a good length and seaming away outside off, past the outside edge
full and on middle and leg, tapped straight to midwicket
pretty full and nips back in, inside-edged onto the pad
length and across the corridor. Defended on the front foot off the utside edge. Bavuma dives to his left, two-handed, to stop that
rises up in the corridor from back of a length and sails past the outside edge as he fishes at it
shorter this time, in the same line. He ducks and drops his wrists to let it go
back of a length on middle, nearly 140ks, forward-defensive
full and sliding into leg stump, he is early into a flick and spoons a leading edge in front of point
Philander floats it full and attacks the stumps, 134.1ks, Burl, standing a foot outside the crease, stretches out and defends stoutly
full and drifting down the leg side, Burl eyes up a flick, but does not make contact. The ball grazes the thigh pad rolls past the right of a diving AB behind the stumps
this is a peach from Philander. Perfectly-pitched ball, Philander finds just enough seam movement to beat the outside edge. Jarvis, though, did well not to reach out for the ball with his hands
shorter on off, hits the sticker of the bat, as Jarvis defends to the off side
pitched up and Philander probes away in the channel outside off, draws an outside edge, Bavuma flings to his right from gully to intercept the ball
full and on a fourth-stump line, driveable length, Jarvis presses forward and push-drives it straight to mid-off

A beauty! Takes top of off stump this time as the wicket cartwheels away beautifully. Pitches on a good length just outside off and angles into the left hander. Burl prodded forward just a little, but the ball zips off the pitch and finds the gap between pad and his forward defense.
short on off stump and gets big on the new man in, has to tiptoe and defend off the back foot
pitched short outside off and directed into Raza's body, he tries to duck under it but the ball takes the bat's shoulder. In the air, but falls just short of the diving third slip fielder
on a good length just outside off, tries to poke at it the ball goes just off the seam, and past his blade

There's the five-for! Back of a length on the fourth-stump line, he tries to push at the ball but there's no footwork in place. Brushes his outside edge and easily pocketed by AB. Raza was glued onto his back foot
back of a length outside off, happy to leave it alone. Nice carry through to the keeper
full on off stump and it's mistimed to short midwicket. The bat turned in his hand as he tried to play straight
another tantalizing delivery from the South African pacers, back of a length just outside off, and flies past his outside edge as he tries to defend off the front foot
play and a miss once again, back of a length just outside off but seams slightly away from the right hander, another attempted defense off the front foot that misses the ball completely
pitches it slightly full outside off and Jarvis gets under this in a flash. Not timed perfectly, but past the diving cover fielder. Was in the air, and has enough legs to find the ropes
short on off stump and it's a slower-ball bouncer. The batsman's taking no chances, he's happy to duck under it
back of a length outside off and angling into Jarvis, defends off the back foot with the bat's open face, guided towards point
starts off with a short ball, pitches outside off and flies past Jarvis' shoulder
fuller ball this time, almost a yorker on off stump and Jarvis does well to get his bat down in time. Takes the toe end of the bat as the ball dribbles away towards cover
tries to shoulder his arms, but he can't get his bat out of the way in time. Pings off the bat as he attempts to get his bat out of the way, was slightly full outside off
good length on off stump and angling into his body, straightens just a bit after pitching. Manages to clip this off his hips to midwicket
back of a length on middle stump and angling across the batsman's body. Left alone
does well to get out the delivery's way. Short on middle and rises onto his body. Manages to back away towards the leg side and avoid the ball
on a good length, pitches on middle. Tucked off his hips to square leg. Calls quickly for the single, and Phehlukwayo misfields

falls just short of mid on! Pitched on middle and driven on the up, it comes off the higher part of the bat, and it's in the air for a moment. Morkel dived to his left but even he's not tall enough to get to the ball
another beauty, but no reward once again. Good length on off stump and he drives down the wrong line. Goes past his outside edge once more
thick outside edge, and flies along the carpet to the deep point boundary. Full ball on off stump and he drives straight, but takes the edge and finds the gap between cover and point
back of a length on off stump, goes deep into the crease and defends firmly off the back foot
pushed to mid off, offers the straight bat to this good-length ball outside off
back of a length on off stump, clipped off his hips to midwicket
back of a length on the fourth-stump line, left alone by Moor
happy to let it go once again, on a good length outside off
good length on middle and drifting down the leg side, AB does well to shuffle across too his right and grab the ball
full just outside off and entices the batsman to drive, just past his outside edge through to the keeper
back of a length outside off and the batsman gets his bat out of the way in a flash. Sees the over through with no further trouble
full on middle and angling down the leg side, tries to nudge this behind square on the leg side, but the extra bounce raps him on his pads instead
good length on off stump, defended off the back foot. Firmly hit back to Rabada
short outside off but not much bounce this time. Shoulders his arms
back of a length outside off and straightens off the pitch, nice shape from Rabada but the batsman chooses not to engage. Left alone
goes short this time, pitches just outside off but it's directed towards Jarvis' body, defended from near his chest off the back foot

fuller ball outside off and driven crisply past mid off, the fielder manages to get his fingertips to it while diving to his right. Philander has to give it a chase, but manages to drag the ball back. Full marks for the effort
overpitched outside off, attempts to drive but takes the toe end of the bat, enough behind that shot to take it towards cover
back of a length on middle and angling into his body, tiptoes and nudges this fine behind. Some work for fine leg to do
full on middle and shapes into his pads, clipped off his pads to fine leg off the front foot
full on off stump, prods forward and defends with the straight bat

another wicket! It's that nagging line just outside off that earns him the wicket, just a bit more bounce and takes the outside edge as he tries to drive off the back foot. Another catch to de Villiers' name
goes short first ball, it pitches outside off and Cremer shoulders his arms
full on middle and angling down the leg side, tries to work this off his pads but can't get bat to ball. Hits his pad outside leg stump
back of a length outside off, tapped off the back foot with soft hands towards short cover. Calls early for the single, and they scamper through
full on off stump but drifting onto his pads, worked off his legs past mid on. Morkel chases it and unconvincingly slides and stops the ball from near the circle
goes just past the top of off stump. On a good length outside off and Cremer shoulders his arms
short outside off and extra bounce this time, flies over the batsman's head as AB has to race towards his left stop the ball from over his head
back of a length on off and angling into his body, hit past the non-striker as it trickles away to mid on. The bat turned in his hand, probably from the pace that Rabada is generating. Early 140s
back of a length outside off, goes deep into the crease and defends off the back foot. Was quick to get behind the line of the ball
fuller ball outside off and he tries to defend away from his body, takes the inside edge and smacks him on his front pad. Could've easily gone on to hit the stumps
back of a length outside off, punched off the back foot but there's protection on the off side
short outside off and gets big onto Moor as he gets his head out of the ball's way
width offered and punished off the back foot. It was short and he waits for the ball to come towards him and cuts late past point's left. No stopping that
overcompensates his line this time, short on off and angling towards the leg side, tapped off his hips to midwicket
ooo, fiery from Rabada but he oversteps. Short on off stump and his the batsman near his guts as it angles into his body
back of a length outside off and goes straight through to the keeper. Cremer gets his arms, and the bat, out of the way
back of a length outside off, defended off the back foot from top of off stump
back of a length outside off once again, this time its directed at the batsman's body. Defended once more off the back foot

straightens after pitching and induces the outside edge! On a good length outside off and Cremer is too slow. Attempts to defend off the front foot but the extra pace beats him with ease. Another outside edge for AB to gobble up
what a welcome to the crease, full and straight on off stump, manages to bring his bat down in time. Played with soft hands as the ball trickles away
overpitched outside off once again, tapped towards cover but played away from his body. Mpofu holding his fort for now

inside edge onto off stump! There's the ninth. Back of a length outside off and the batsman's not sure whether he wants to come forward and go deep, eventually attempts to defend off the back foot but there's a wide enough gap between bat and pad. Thick inside edge, and rattles the stumps
short ball to start off, pitches outside off and flies past the batsman's eyeline
'how did that miss off stump' wonders the bowler after pitching this. Full on off stump as the batsman attempts to slog this over the leg side, goes just over off stump
back of a length just outside off, gets his bat out of ball's line
full outside off and another wild slog attempted from the debutant. Can't make contact and through to AB

good length on off stump and this time he smacks this over the non-striker's head. Gets his front foot out of the way and played with a high shoulder. Shows his follow through off as the ball races away to the long on boundary. First runs in Test cricket for the man
back of a length outside off, and generates some extra bounce this time. Left alone by the batsman, but he's overstepped

The fifth lowest total for Zimbabwe in Test cricket! All out for 68 in just over 30 overs. It was once again on that tantalizing fourth-stump line and the batsman chooses to poke at it. Finds the outside edge and easily collected by the fielder at gully, who dives forward and pockets this with ease
short and wide outside off, left alone
back of a length and in the corridor, defended off the back foot
full at leg stump, no movement, no zip off the surface. Clipped through midwicket on the rise
good length and wide outside off, left alone
short ball, lifting outside off. Left alone
full at middle stump, driven on the up past the non-striker
good length at middle stump, tapped into the leg side on the up
back of a length and shaping away in the corridor, defended into the covers with an open face
back of a length, shaping away outside off. Fishes with a very weirdly angled bat. Beaten
good length outside off, defended from the crease
back of a length and shaping away outside off, left alone
back of a length at middle stump, defended into the leg side off the back foot
full and wide outside off, left alone
good length and just outside off. Defends inside the line and squeezes it past backward point
short ball cuts back in from outside off. Batsman is forced to arch into the leg side in addition to dropping his wrists as he lets this go
good length at middle stump, pushed to midwicket off the inside half of the bat
back of a length in the corridor, defended into the covers off the back foot
beaten on the outside edge as he swishes at this outside off with no feet
good length, shaping away towards off stump. Defended on the front foot
good length at off stump, straightens a touch. Defended down the pitch
good length outside off, pushes at it on the front foot. Beaten
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
good length, slight wobble outside off. Left alone
bowls it full at middle stump from close to the non-striker's stumps. Chamu flicks towards mid-on with a closed face
good length wide outside off, left alone
good length and climbing up at off stump. Goes deep in the crease and tickles it towards fine leg
good length in the corridor, left alone

good length and zipping in from outside off. Does well to take the bottom hand off as he allows this to come onto the bat...The ball seems to have struck him on the back elbow as he was trying to take it off the bat. Getting some spray treatment. He's having difficulty moving that arm now too. Looks like they're considering taking him off. He was hit flush on the elbow and the flexibility of that arm has been affected. Physio's run some tests to see how his grip is...and they've decided he should go. Masakadza walking off.
outside edge lands short of third slip, who diving forward and to his right. This straightens after angling in at the corridor and drawing a forward defence from him
good length at off stump, defends close to his front pad, off the inside half
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
length and in at off stump, somehow manages to get bat on this after planting the front leg across. Taps it wide of mid-on from right in front of middle stump
full and swinging into leg stump, leading edge as he looks to bunt it into the leg side. Similar ball to the one he fell to last evening
good length and in the corridor, left alone
back of a length outside off, nips away off the surface and past the attempted defence on the back foot
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
short ball in the corridor, drops his wrists and lets it pass
bouncer at middle stump, ducks well under it
full at off stump, driven back to the bowler
shot. It's wide and there for the cut. He swipes from under it and gets it to the point fence
good length and outside off, left alone
good length, starts on leg stump and swings further down
fuller this time, but once again it starts on leg and swings further. He looks to flick and there's a half-appeal as AB pouches this. Not out
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
back of a length at middle stump, defended on the back foot
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
full and in at off stump, defended on the front foot
tossed up at off stump, defended on the front foot
length at middle stump, defended off the inside half
tossed up outside off, left alone
full and drifted down leg side, looks to tickle it fine and deflects it off his pad
good length, drifting in at off, spinning away very slightly to beat the outside edge as he pushes on the front foot
full at off stump, pushed back to the bowler on the front foot
good length at off stump, defended down the pitch
overpitched outside off, checks the drive after getting to the pitch. Gets it to mid-off's right. Morkel puts in a tumble to stop it
good length in the corridor, defended to point off the outside half
back of a length outside off, handsomely punched on the up, but he can't beat Andile's dive at cover point
good length and pushed far down leg side, AB can't stop with the dive
back of a length outside off, pushed into the covers from the crease
full outside off, gets down quickly and paddles it fine with expert care. Nicely done
length outside off, defended on the front foot

beats the inside edge and AB de Villiers. That is a beautiful ball. You've heard of late swing - he gets late drift, away from the batsman, drawing him into the cover drive and then spinning in rapidly from the rough
length at off stump, defended on the front foot
full at off stump, gets down and paddles it again. Fine leg in place this time
good length and spinning into the pad as he presses forward. Well outside the line
good length at off stump, defended to mid-on off the back foot
back of a length in the corridor, tapped to extra cover on the up
bouncer too short, gets under it easily
back of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
good length at off stump, defended off the back foot
short and wide outside off, looks to cut, beaten
good length outside off, defended to short leg off the inside half
full at off stump, defended to midwicket on the front foot

gorgeous shot. Oh I can't remember a better looking one this match. Skips down and meets this at the pitch wide outside off, despite the drift away. Then he uses his full reach to chip it calmly over the wide long-on boundary
spins past the inside edge and nearly sneaks onto off stump off his pads. Was looking to defend on the front foot
full at off stump, defended on the front foot
length at middle stump, pushed to midwicket on the front foot
full on off stump, and on the money first up. Attacks off stump and the batsman defends with soft hands. Bat turns in his hand, but did well to cover the line of the ball
back of a length wide outside off, shapes further away and Chibhabha gets on top of this ball in a flash. Carved in front of square off the back foot, and that's four
back of a length wide outside off, left alone this time
good length on off stump, forces the batsman to come inside the line of the ball and defend off the back foot
good length on middle and angling down the leg side. AB attempts to dive but it's too wide for him as well. No contact but the umpire thinks it's brushed the outside of the pad
back of a length on off stump, angling down the leg side but the batsman can't clip this off his pads. Hits his front thigh, but outside leg stump
full just outside off, spinning into the left-hander's body, defended off the front foot
full ball on middle stump, defended
back of a length outside off stump, spins into his body, tucked off his hips behind square to short fine leg
tossed up full on off stump, big stride forward and blocked
full outside off stump, drives towards cover but mistimes
takes the outside edge but just past first slip, forcing short third man to give it a chase. Was beautifully tossed up outside off and the batsman was enticed to poke at it. The plan almost worked
back of a length outside off, defended off the back foot towards cover. Firmly hit
back of a length outside off, straightens after pitching. Tries to punch at it off the back foot, but brings his bat back
back of a length on off stump, defended off his hips to square leg. Calls early for the run
good length on leg stump, flicked off his pads towards the leg side. Quick ball, and well negated by Ervine
back of a length on middle and angling across the batsman's body, left alone
good length on off stump, angling across his body once again. Shoulders his arms to see the over off
flat ball on leg stump, tries to work it towards the leg side but takes the edge, but falls in front of his toes. Short leg was there, but didn't fall near him
good length on middle stump, punched off the front foot to mid on
tossed up full outside of, pre-meditated reverse sweep from Ervine this time. Enough bat behind that shot to take it past first slip, and the left-hander's short third man. Races away to the boundary
full outside off but slightly wider, prods forward to defend, but hits his pad
full on off stump, turned off his pads past short leg. The ball stayed low this time
good length outside off to end the over, tapped towards the leg side, but short leg intercepts

back of a length outside off and angling into the right-hander, slightly extra bounce this time and he can't work this towards the leg side. Trapped on the back foot and hits him on his front thigh. That must've hurt

there's the breakthrough! Beautiful delivery just outside off and it's that extra bounce that does the trick again.Tries to poke at it, and then attempts to pull his bat away but it's too late. Takes the outside edge as he looks to drag his blade back. Another scalp for AB to catch
back of a length just outside off, defended
good length on off stump, shuffles across to the off side and pushes towards mid on
good length on off stump, shapes into his body and he turns this with the angle towards square leg. Stays deep in the crease
back of a length outside off, tapped back to the bowler. Played away from his body. Looked to punch this towards cover, but the bat turned in his hand
overpitched full outside off, big stride forward and defended
tossed up outside off once again, attempts to drive this past Maharaj, but the bowler does well to intercept on his followthrough
good length outside off this time, he attempts to defend once more but finds the outside edge. Doesn't carry to Amla at slip
full ball outside off and turns into his body, looks to block off the front foot but the turn takes it past his bat and into his body
good length just outside off, stays deep in the crease and works this off his pads past short leg
full just outside off, nice shape as the ball goes straight through to AB. Fiery pace

back of a length on off stump, decked in off the seam and Taylor was stranded in his crease. Tried to play this towards the leg side but the extra bounce smacks him near his abdomens. Hopefully he had protection
good length just outside off and straightens after pitching off the surface. Taylor attempts to drive at it but he plays inside the line of the ball. Just shy of the outside edge
good length on off stump, punched off the front foot towards mid off
short on middle stump, going high over the batsman's head as the ball angles down the leg side
good length just outside off and angling into his body, firmly defended off the front foot past the non-striker. Short mid on stops the ball
full just outside off, turned off his toes to square leg
uses his feet to come down the pitch this time. First time the batsmen have attacked the spinner, driven down the ground past the outstretched hands of mid on
full and wide outside off, offers the batsman some room to free his arms, but he chooses to check his drive
good length on off stump, goes deep into the crease and defends off the back foot. Straight to short mid on
good length outside off, punched off the front foot towards cover
back of a length outside off, stays deep in his crease and punches this off the back foot to mid on. There's protection there

short on leg stump and gets big on the batsman, hits his glove as he tries to play with soft hands towards the leg side, goes to short fine leg along the carpet. He was gone if short leg was still in place
slightly full on off stump and Taylor gently taps this towards the leg side. Finds the gap in front of midwicket, and there's no stopping that ball once it crosses the infield
back of a length outside off stump, shoulders his arms this time
full on middle stump, shuffles across to get inside the line of the ball and defends
short on off stump and once again challenges him with the bouncer. Unconvincingly flicked from near his chest to short fine leg. Hits his glove
beautiful yorker on middle stump and Ervine does superbly to keep this out. Brings his bat down in time and squeezes this delivery out. Inside edge that ricochets onto his pads
full on middle stump, turned off his toes to deep midwicket
tossed up full just outside off, glanced off his hips to short fine leg
tossed up full outside off, driven along the ground to Maharaj off the front foot
back of a length outside off, waits for the ball to come to him before nudging this off his hips to deep midwicket

shimmies down the ground and lifted over Morkel at mid off! Comes to the pitch of the ball and played with the straight bat over the infielder's head. Not perfectly timed, but enough muscle behind that shot
good length on off stump this time, defended with the full face of the bat
on the money first ball, full on off stump, and forcing the batsman to play at it. Driven back to the bowler
good length on middle stump, stays low as he works this off his hips to midwicket. Calls early for the single, and easily completed
full ball just outside off, defended off the front foot after getting a big stride ahead
back of a length on off stump but angling down the leg side, tapped behind square on the leg side. And Zimbabwe go past their first innings score
short on middle stump and angling away from the left hander, punched well off the back foot but straight to the man positioned at cover. Came off the bat's sweet spot
good length on leg stump, tapped towards the man at short midwicket
full outside off and driven uppishly. It was in the air, but just past short cover and short of extra cover
good length on middle stump, blocked off the back foot
full on middle stump, Taylor shuffles across to the leg side and drives inside-out to mid off
full and flat on middle stump, tapped back to the bowler off the front foot
good length on off stump, Taylor stays glued to his crease as he attempts to carve this towards the off side. Can only play to the man at point

threads the gap this time! Drops the length, and it's wide enough for Taylor to make the contact he was looking for. Punched off the back foot with the bat's open face and it dissects cover point and point
back of a length on middle stump, defended off the front foot. Straight to short cover
short on off stump but can't extract the kind of bounce Rabada and Morkel were getting. Angles across the left hander and through to the keeper. No shot offered
stays low and just past his outside edge. Good length on middle and Ervine tries to defend down the wrong line. Vertical movement after pitching and that's what foxes the batsman
good length on middle stump, punched off the back foot past the non-striker. Morkel at mid off dives to his left and keeps it down to a single
full ball on leg stump, tries to turn this off his hips to midwicket but through his shot too early. Thickish edge takes it towards square leg instead. Only 124 kph
full on off stump and driven with the angle, well fielded by Bavuma at cover however
full ball on middle stump, tapped down the ground
full on middle once again, this time he opens his feet just a bit so that he doesn't get cramped. Defended inside-out
full on middle and leg this time, defended off the front foot
back of a length outside off, no turn this time and Taylor sees the ball through to AB's gloves
swept well, but stopped at short fine leg. Full on leg stump and Taylor was quick to get down on one knee

It's a reverse sweep that's gone wrong! Amla pockets at first slip, but the umpire wants to confirm if it has carried. Taylor asks Amla if the catch is clean and Hashim says it's out. Taylor is walking back but the umpires want to check anyway. He tried to reverse sweep but takes the face of the bat and onto Taylor's back-leg pad, thereby lobbing the ball up. Amla's outstretched right hand gets just under the ball as it settles into his palm. Soft signal was out. Some replays suggest that the ball may have bounced, but some replays make it look like it's a clean catch. Third umpire think's its out, though, and Taylor finally makes his way out. Wonder what the decision would've been if the soft signal was 'not out'
