Another wicket! Good length on middle stump and traps the batsman in front of the stumps. Hits his front pad and then his back pad, and looks like it would've gone on to crash into middle and off. Just that extra zip off the surface, and the bowler gets his reward
starts off with the short ball, pitches on off stump and gets big onto Raza. Somehow manages to play this from near his chest towards short leg. Not at all comfortable while playing it
good length on off stump, stays in his crease and punches this off the back foot. But there's protection at short cover
full on off stump, goes back into the crease and blocks off the back foot
good length on middle stump, tapped off his hips to midwicket
overpitched outside off and driven past cover, advances down the wicket and crunched off the front foot. Hit on the up
good length outside off and tapped to silly point. The fielder is agile, and throws the ball back at the stumps, but just misses Raza's stumps

what has Raza done here? Gifts Maharaj a wicket. Tries to hit the bowler out of the attack but the spinner wins this battle. Tossed up full on off and he tries to hit this out of the park. It's a leading edge instead, and caught by Phehlukwayo with ease
full just outside off and spins away, tries to poke at it but zips away after pitching. Sharp take from the keeper
full just outside off and spins away after pitching, left alone

beatiful delivery to end the over, drifts this on off stump and the ball grips off the surface on this occasion. The ball flies past the outside edge of the batsman's blade. So close to the outside edge

And the change of angle works! It's full and just outside off and forces the batsman to drive at it. Just the slight shape away from the left hander after pitch and that's enough to take the outside edge. Sharp take from de Villiers, who has to dive to his left
good length on middle stump, defended
full just outside off, attempted drive that's mistimed from Hammy this time. Dribbles away to cover

full on middle and misses the straight drive completely. Hits his front leg but would've gone down leg side for certain. Loud appeal for the lbw however, but the ball was doing too much with the angle for it to have hit the stumps. A good decision from the umpire
back of a length outside off, walks inside the line of the ball and blocks off the back foot
full on middle stump, driven down the ground to end the over
full ball just outside off, tapped to mid off for a quick run. No turn this time
using the width of the crease to angle the ball in, Maharaj. Tossed up on off stump but defended with ease off the front foot
full and flat on off stump this time, dug away with minimal movement of the feet towards mid on
back of a length outside off and spins away from the right-hander, stays deep in the crease and attempts to cut but mistimed
slog swept! Full on middle and leg and authoritatively swatted over deep midwicket for a maximum. In the slot and punished
full on middle and leg, darted into the batsman, defended off the front foot. And that's drinks.
short and wide outside off, under-edges the cut into the covers

a late decision to give him caught-behind and he reviews it. Superb ball, climbing in rapidly from outside off. He looks to defend, but it's tentative. Withdraws the bat late as well. Clearly caught in two minds. It's a very very faint edge, hardly any disturbance during the replay, but a big enough one as the ball is adjacent to the inside edge of the bat. Good decision. That was faint enough for him not to feel it, so the review can't be critcised either. Superb bowling, that came in, with the shiny side
back of a length outside off, fishes and misses
shot. Length ball just outside off, leans in neatly and punches firmly past the bowler
back of a length outside off, left alone
swings into him in the air, pitches and rips away like a legbreak. Beats him in the corridor
full at off stump, defended to silly point
good length at off stump, defended into the covers
length at off, blocked on front foot
length on middle, dead-batted into the pitch
back of a length at off stump, defended on the back foot
short and wide outside off, doesn't go after it
back of a length outside off, left alone
overpitched outside off, driven with absolutely no feet, straight to mid-off. Not an issue with technique - his spikes were stuck in the turf
back of a length outside off, left alone
good length and in the corridor, exposes off and middle as he leaves this
good length, swinging way down leg
full and just outside off, inside edge on the cover drive. Trickles out to mid-on
length at off, defended on the front foot
big edge and AB takes it. Good length ball, drifted in at off stump. Spins and bounces sharply from there after drawing him forward. AB in the perfect position to take his eighth catch of the game
full outside off, leans in and drives uppishly to mid-off's right
back of a length at middle stump, defended on the back foot
short and climbing up outside off, left alone
full on off, defended down the pitch
back of a length at off stump, defended into the leg side
full and wide outside off, slashes at it, beaten
back of a length outside off, left alone
short ball in the corridor, drops his wrists and leaves
back of a length at off stump, dug into the pitch off the inside edge as he defends on the back foot
full and outside off, a flowing drive that he gets bat on this time and sends to the extra cover boundary
tossed up full outside off, driven uppishly to mid-off
back of a length at middle stump, defended on the back foot
full at middle stump, defended with a quarter of a stride
good length outside off, left alone
full and fired in at middle stump, no feet and somehow manages to save this from crashing into leg stump
full at off stump, driven on the bounce to short extra cover
good length and in at leg stump, cops it on the pad as he looks to play the flick
full outside off, draws him into the drive and beats him with a late awayswinger
full and shaping away towards middle, but not quick enough to go past his bat as he clips to mid-on
good length, shaped away from outside off. Beats the outside edge on the drive

tonks off stump. An ugly shot. Nowhere near the pitch, nowhere close to being behind the line as he looks for an on-drive. It's a straight ball angled in at off stump on a good length, he's playing way inside the line
good length and swinging away from outside off, left alone
good length on off, spinning rapidly away past the outside edge
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
full and in at middle stump, plants the front leg forward, swipes across the line and manages just enough bat to get this past backward square
full, slingy delivery, coming in at off stump. Shovels it to long-off
length ball drifted in at off stump, spins away and under his attempted sweep

loses his shape completely against what looks like he could have hit as a full toss. It's floated in at middle stump, he wants to sweep, then he wants to drive inside-out. It opens a big passage between bat and pad and he's bowled
back of a length at off stump, defended solidly on the back foot
good length at middle stump, poked to midwicket off the inside edge as he looks to drive on the rise
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
good length in the corridor, defended to mid-off on the front foot
back of a length in the corridor, defended on the back foot

oh lovely shot. Kevin Pietersen, are you watching? Length ball at off stump. Walks a long way across to expose middle and leg, then whips it fine. Maharaj sprints to his right at fine leg and can't keep it in with a slide
shot. Eight runs in Test career, two fours, one over mid-on in the first innings and now a classy one over mid-off. Full and he uses his wrists to clear that fielder
buh-bye! The perfect slog. Tossed up at middle stump, swings the long levers across the line, head looking at long leg, ball sailing over the midwicket boundary
full toss outside off, head ends up pointing at long leg again, ball sliced on the bounce to cover
beaten outside off as he slogs at this length ball outside off
back of a length on middle stump, defended off the back foot
length outside off, very slow. Heaves across the line with his long reach, but can't get bat on it
full outside off, leans in and slices this past point with an open face
good length in the corridor, defended on the front foot
good length outside off, left alone
back of a length outside off, tapped to extra cover
full and just outside off, pushed into the off side off the front foot
good length, swinging away late at an off stump line. Tapped into the covers off the outside half
full, dipping at off stump, spinning away from the batsman's wild swing
full and dropping at leg stump. Steps out and cops it on the pad after missing the flick
full at off stump, swipes across the line, misses it and loses his off stump. That's the match.
